topic.title: Intermediate Node Datapath 1

body.p: This datapath involves the following path:

li.p: LINEOTN(OTUk <= => ODUk) <= => COREOTN(ODUk <= => ODUflex) <= => COPI(ODUflex <= => ILKN)

body.p: This datapath represents either Node A, B or C, where the ODUkP/ODUj-21 adaptation function is directly connected to the fabric rather than directly to the source/sink of the ODUkP/PCK adaptation function. Figure 1 represents the datapath through the device subsystems:
body.note: http://bby1dms01.pmc-sierra.internal/docmgmt/fileinfo.cfm?file_id=416475 tab : Hitles ODUflex Resizing Block Diagram. (layer ROW on, layer MSCCInternal off, layer GHAOSSDP1 off, GHAOSSNDP2 on, other layers leave as is)
body.p: The LCR steps for increase/decrease are done through the ODTUJ4 MUX and ODTUJ4 DMX, and from an ILKN interface perspective, the fabric has to resize as well appropriately in LCR steps. The potential opportunity to resize the fabric is after the LCR knife edge of the ODTUJ4 DMX and ODTUJ4 MUX. The flex can either land on the HO MUX/DMX between framer stage 1-2 (1 stage muxing case with HO ODU4) or between framer stage 2-3A (2 stage muxing case with HO ODUCn and LO ODU4).
In BWR, setting of TSCC is done in the ODTUJ4 MUX and receiving is done in the ODTUJ4 DMX. GMP special mode is realized by setting the SAR into hold-over.

The ramp in the egress direction (towards the LINEOTN), is triggered by receiving the BWR_IND bit in the ODUflex at stage 3B RFRM and relaying it back to SAR. In the ingress direction (from the LINEOTN), there is no need for the device to generate the ramp if communicating via the ILKN (the far-end device will ramp appropriately). If in the ingress direction, the datapath communicates via FIC, then the BWR_IND is picked up from either RFRM stage 2 or stage 3a (depending on muxing stages) and forwards the bit to the SAR to commence the ramp. Once the SAR receives BWR_IND, it will commence the ramp at the ramp rate, modulated by the ODUk Switch fill level.
Once the ramp is complete, the SAR will issue a ‘ramp_done’ interrupt which will allow software to complete the G.HAO protocol by finishing LCR using the ODTUJ4 MUX and DMX.
